definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: There is no denying, that as a challenger now, we have a fight on our hands.
sentences.chinese: 不可否认，我们作为挑战者，将有一场硬仗要打。

sentences.english: and an aging Challenger-class diesel submarine, the Conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 和老化的挑战者级柴油潜艇“征服者”。

sentences.english: The challenger showed the white feather as soon as he stepped into the ring with the champion.
sentences.chinese: 这位挑战者同冠军一踏进拳击场时就胆怯了。

sentences.english: The defending champoin won the first set, but the challenger took the second.
sentences.chinese: 擂主赢了第一回合，但是第二回合是挑战者获胜。

sentences.english: The champion dropped the challenger in the fourth round.
sentences.chinese: 这位冠军在第四回合把挑战者击倒在地。
已经连续两年没有挑战者了。

sentences.english: The challenger is kayo in the first round. (also k. o. )
sentences.chinese: 挑战者在第一个回合，就被击倒在地上。

sentences.english: In the hall the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大厅俚肤浅的挑战者将被允许吞下燕子。

sentences.english: The challenger climbed into the ring.
sentences.chinese: 冠军挑战者垮过绳圈进入拳击台。

sentences.english: Sonus and Cisco continue to be the strongest challengers posting substantial growth in NAM and EMEA, respectively.
sentences.chinese: 思科仍是最强的挑战者张贴大幅增长，将由南分别。

sentences.english: The RDE global challengers' rapid growth is far from over.
sentences.chinese: 中印两国全球挑战者的快速成长还远没有结束。

sentences.english: Communitarianism poses a challenge to liberalism, and Mechael Walzer is a representative communitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 社群主义是主流思想的挑战者，代表人物是沃尔策。

sentences.english: The challenger was dumped twice but won the fight.
sentences.chinese: 这名冠军挑战者曾两次被击倒，但最后赢了比赛。

sentences.english: They have to crawl under yards and yards of barbed wire.
sentences.chinese: 在这一项目中，挑战者需要在带刀片的铁丝网下爬行。

sentences.english: For our purposes, we are looking at how the challengers compare to each other.
sentences.chinese: 对于我们而言，我们正在研究如何互相比较挑战者。

sentences.english: Challenger broke free, lumbered past the launch tower.
sentences.chinese: “挑战者”号突然腾起，笨拙地沿着发射塔上升。

definition: elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
